comments.raw_text:
First of all I am not sure, if this is a bug or an enhancement...

If you open the Address Book, select a Mailing List and click "File -> New -> Message"; a new Message Compose Window opens and the members of the mailing list are added automatically as recipients (To) by Thunderbird.

But: If you open the Address Book, select one Address Book, e.g. "Personal Address Book", and click "File -> New -> Message"; a new Message Compose Window opens, but the members of the address book are *not* added automatically as recipients (To) by Thunderbird.

I don't know, if that is the intended behavior... But it would be really helpful, if the members of the address book would be added automatically as recipients (To) in this case. (Just like they are for mailing lists.)

But this was the behavior for mailing lists and it should be the behavior for mailing lists once the regression is fixed.

comments.text:
I think, it is much easier to select the address book and then hit "File -> New -> Message" (or the toolbar button "Write") - instead of having to select all recipients manually first.

And as this is already the default behavior for mailing lists, I'd expect it to be the very same for address books, too.
